main.name: Ruoyun Sun
main.bio: I'm passionate about programming, and I have finished many projects so far, which include a movie search engine and several web development projects.
main.contactmessage: Please contact me via normal email if you have important messages.

work.company: Northeastern University, Khoury College of Computer Sciences, Seattle, WA
work.title: Teaching Assistant for CS5800 Algorithms
description: Instructed 60 graduate students in algorithms by holding weekly office hours
Communicated with instructors and other TAs to synchronize grading policy

work.company: Zhixing Internet of Things Technology Co., Ltd., China
work.title: Data Analyst Intern
description: Improved work efficiency by 30% through leveraging Python statistical packages (Pandas/NumPy/SciPy/Matplotlib) and SQL to do data cleaning, data analysis and data visualization on data collected from >100 charging stations
Used DBSCAN to design and optimize a model to distinguish different electric vehicle types based on >5000 charging curves and increase machine learning model accuracy from 60% to 80%
Worked cross-functionally with product and engineering to define key metrics and support decision making

projects.title: Issue Tracker Application (JavaScript, React, GraphQL, Express, MongoDB)
details: Led the design and implementation of a full-stack application in the proxy mode to help users create, edit, filter and delete issues; Improved work efficiency of software engineers by 60% in issue tracking and management
Designed and implemented a set of GraphQL APIs with Node.js server and MongoDB database for the ease and efficiency of data query and mutation from frontend
Boosted load performance by 30% through implementing Server-side Rendering for the initial page and applying Babel and Webpack
Increased web security on authentication and authorization with JSON web token (JWT) method

projects.title: Multiprocessing Movie Search Engine (C, Linux, Valgrind, Emacs)
details: Designed a file crawler, a file indexer and a file processor to process >5 million movies in about 50 different files, applied Google Test and exposed high-level abstracted APIs
Boosted performance by 10% through implementing a multi-threaded file parser
Developed a query processor using socket programming with TCP/IP protocol suites that concurrently serves multiple clients and increases throughput

projects.title: User Management Microservices (Java, Spring Boot, RESTful, Spring Cloud, MySQL)
details: Designed and implemented RESTful Microservices with Spring Boot and Spring Cloud with integration of MySQL; Dockerized microservices on AWS EC2
Implemented user authentication and authorization with Spring Security and JWT
Used Spring Cloud Bus and RabbitMQ to broadcast configuration changes with encryption supported by JCE
Traced HTTP requests with Spring Cloud Sleuth and Zipkin; Improved efficiency by 20% by aggregating log files in one place with ELK stack (Logstash, Elasticsearch, Kibana)

projects.title: Task Management System (Java, JUnit)
details: Designed a full-stack personalized task management application compatible with Windows and macOS using MVC framework allowing users to create and organize to-do lists
Implemented a general command line parser and a flexible filter via Builder and Factory design patterns
Covered 98% by unit tests implemented in JUnit
Led a team of 3 developers, performed industry-level teamwork using Git, exchanged information via interfaces and scheduled meetings frequently for multi-level collaboration

projects.title: Othello Game Design(Python)
projects.location: Northeastern University, Khoury College of Computer Sciences, Seattle, WA
details: Used Python to design disk, board and player classes and write tests using unit-test, improved user-friendliness by producing user interface with Processing and customizing board
Established game controller to launch initial setup and automatically switch user control, placed and flipped disks to keep the game orderly
Built artificial intelligence in order to make the game more challenging when playing against opponents
Recorded the scores in real time, displayed the results and refreshed the leader board

projects.title: Campgrounds Experience Sharing Website (JavaScript)
details: Developed the website under Amazon Cloud9 and deployed it on Heroku with integration of MongoDB Atlas
Implemented RESTful server-side logic under Express.js, enabled users to signup, login, share and comment on campgrounds posts, and supported authentication service through routers
Built front-end through Bootstrap and jQuery, with the functionality of action-triggered response
Implemented data persistence layer with MongoDB

projects.title: Relationship Prediction between mRNA and Diseases (MATLAB)
details: Applied and implemented an adapted random walk algorithm in MATLAB for vicinity prediction of a diseases-mRNA multiplex network and accuracy reached 90% in some diseases

Established a de novo algorithm using weighted K nearest known neighbors and collaborative filtering for optimizing the incidence matrix of diseases-mRNA graph, which significantly increased the precision and recall of the algorithm

skills.name: Languages: Python, JavaScript, Java, C, HTML/CSS, GraphQL, C++, MATLAB, R, SQL
Frameworks/Libraries: Express, JUnit, React, Sprint Boot, jQuery, Bootstrap, React Bootstrap, Processing, MVC
Others: Heroku, Gradle, npm, Node.js, nvm, MongoDB, MySQL, Webpack, Git, Ubuntu, Emacs, Valgrind, AWS Cloud9, ESLint
